content: fingering weight yarn is my favorite weight to work with and over the past few years i have ended up with quite a collection of partial skeins i was playing with them one day and thought that knitting a hat with two strands slowly changing colors would be a fun way to use some of them up yummy 2-ply held double makes such a wonderfully squishy fabric that i was instantly hooked and have already knit 6 of these hats the pattern is simple but the opportunity to play with colors is endless pull out your bag of odds and ends find 6 or more or fewer colors you like together and cast on **yarn** miss babs yummy 2-ply 100% superwash merino wool 400 yd/4 oz 365 m/115g skeins shown in a variety of monochromatic and variegated colorways with 6 colors used per hat or approximately 290 350 yards/265 320 meters of fingering weight yarn divided amongst 6 colors the first and last colors used for ribbing and crown of hat use a little more than 50 60 yards/45 55 meters each the middle colors a little less
